Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பாத்தூண் மரீஇ யவனைப் பசியென்னும்தீப்பிணி தீண்டல் அரிது.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The fiery disease of hunger shall never touch him who habitually distributes his food to others.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown whose habit is to always share their food with others before they eat ('பாத்து ஊண் மரீஇ').
Layered_Composition.Midground: Because of this constant habit of charity, a powerful, protective, cool blue aura of grace forms around them.
Layered_Composition.Background: The 'fiery disease of hunger' ('பசி என்னும் தீப் பிணி') is personified as a monstrous beast made of black smoke and cruel, red flames. This beast is shown trying to attack the charitable person, but it cannot touch them ('தீண்டல் அரிது'). It is repelled by the cool, protective aura generated by their habit of sharing.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The person whose character is defined by the habit of sharing their food is protected from ever being touched by the fiery disease of hunger.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The habit of sharing creating a protective, cooling shield is the key visual. Hunger as a fiery, demonic beast provides a powerful antagonist. The immunity of the charitable person is absolute.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The charitable person is surrounded by a calm, cool, blue-white light of protection. The hunger-beast is a chaotic, fiery mixture of black and red. The image is a clear contrast between cool serenity and fiery affliction.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A wide shot showing the serene, protected person and the frustrated, impotent hunger-beast trying and failing to attack them.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with advanced fire and energy shield effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The cool aura of charity is the protective light source that keeps the fiery darkness at bay.

Cultural_Anchors: He who is habituated to sharing his food (பாத்து ஊண் மரீஇயவன்)
The fiery disease of hunger will not touch him (பசி என்னும் தீப் பிணி தீண்டல் அரிது)
